title: Drawing, Design for a State Coach or a Sedan Chair, before 1695
title_raw: Design for a State Coach or a Sedan Chair
medium: pen and black ink, brush and gray wash and red, sepia and yellow watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper
markings: Watermark: Strassburg lily in a shield, surmounted by a crown (cut off)
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower right:  Daniel Marot fecit.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, below image: numerical annotations.
description: Side panel decoration of coach or chair showing the allegorical figure of Peace seated in an elaborate enframement. Below, the arms of Holland.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Design for a State Coach or a Sedan Chair, before 1695; Designed by Daniel Marot (French, active Netherlands and England, 1661–1752); Netherlands; pen and black ink, brush and gray wash and red, sepia and yellow watercolor, graphite on off-white laid paper; 34.3 x 25.7 cm (13 1/2 x 10 1/8 in. ); 1956-15-2
